intro: Balsamiflua mexicana subsp. dimorpha, commonly known as the Mexican balsam or yellow balsam, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while the stems are slender and branching. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments.
